Package com.cafean.client.ui

Class MainToolbarManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cafean.client.ui.MainToolbarManager
  • public class MainToolbarManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This utility class manages all the tool bars in the main JToolBar for ApplicationFrame. Tool bars have a visible status and a hidden status. Hidden tool bars are not visible and do not present activation check boxes in the right-click pop-up menu. The animation playback controls and time tool bars are hidden when there is not an "Animatable" model open. Non-visible tool bars have been explicitly disabled by the user through the right-click pop-up menu. By default all menus are visible. The visibility status is stored in the preferences by the unique toolbar identifier.

    • Method Detail

      • addToolbar

        public void addToolbar​(java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.String display,
                       javax.swing.JToolBar toolbar)
        Adds another JToolBar to the tool bar manager. This method is called by plug-ins to ensure that their tool bars are added to the main JToolBar.
        Parameters:
        name - the unique string for the tool bar.
        display - the text for the enabling check box.
        toolbar - the JToolBar that is being added.

      • getInsertionIndex

        public int getInsertionIndex()
        Returns the index where a new tool bar should be inserted in the toolbar. This is used by ApplicationFrame to build the GridBagConstraints for added menus.
        Returns:

      • setToolbarVisible

        public void setToolbarVisible​(java.lang.String name,
                              boolean visible)
        This method sets the visible state for the tool bar with the given name. This method sets the current selection state of the pop-up menu check box menu item and sets the visible state of the tool bar. If the tool bar is hidden the tool bar will not appear regardless of the "visible" state.
        Parameters:
        name - the unique identifier for the tool bar.
        visible - the visible state of the tool bar.
        See Also:
        setToolbarHidden(java.lang.String, boolean)

      • setToolbarHidden

        public void setToolbarHidden​(java.lang.String name,
                             boolean hidden)
        This method sets the hidden state for the tool bar with the given name. Hidden tool bars are not visible, and do not appear in the list of tool bars in the right-click pop-up menu. This feature allows the list of available tool bars to update based on plug-in specific behavior. Hidden tool bars asre invisible regardless of the visible option selected by the user.
        Parameters:
        name - the unique identifier for the tool bar.
        hidden - the hidden state of the tool bar.
        See Also:
        setToolbarVisible(java.lang.String, boolean)

      • storePreferences

        public void storePreferences​(SnapPreferences prefs)
        This stores the user flag for activation of each tool bar in the SnapPreferences.
        Parameters:
        prefs - the SnapPreferences being stored.

      • loadPreferences

        public void loadPreferences​(SnapPreferences prefs)
        This loads the user flag for activation of each tool bar in the SnapPreferences.
        Parameters:
        prefs - the SnapPreferences being stored.

      • showToolbarPopup

        public void showToolbarPopup​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent evt)
        Creates and displays the pop-up menu for enabling and disabling the tool bars. Only non-hidden tool bars are included in the pop-up menu.
